definition: to approach/to rise high/thick ice/to insult or maltreat
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)

sentences.english: The materialistic pattern of life is one in which money predominates over everything.
sentences.chinese: 真正的拜金主義生活方式是讓金錢凌駕於一切之上。
然而，法院下達的命令有時候會凌駕於這條規定。

sentences.english: Does our gut instinct for self-preservation override our moral reasoning?
sentences.chinese: 自衛的本能凌駕於道德之上嗎？

sentences.english: We have allowed the means by which we live to outdistance the ends for which we live.
sentences.chinese: 我們放任生活的手段凌駕於生活的目的之上。

sentences.english: There he stood, grown suddenly tall, towering above them.
sentences.chinese: 他站在那兒，忽然變得極其高大，凌駕於他們之上。

sentences.english: Melodies of life, To the sky beyond the flying birds - forever and beyond.
sentences.chinese: 生命的旋律，直到凌駕于飛鳥的天空，永遠在那彼端。

sentences.english: No individual shall overtop the law.
sentences.chinese: 任何個人的權力都不能凌駕於法律之上。

sentences.english: Often the warlords operate above the law.
sentences.chinese: 這些軍閥經常凌駕於法律之上。

sentences.english: but no one's above the President.
sentences.chinese: 而沒人能凌駕於總統之上。

sentences.english: Thus Nimrod ascribed to himself power and authority over his fellow man and ruled them.
sentences.chinese: 因此寧錄以他的權威凌駕於他的子民之上並統治他們。

sentences.english: But press freedom does not mean that the press should be above the law.
sentences.chinese: 但是媒體自由並不意味着媒體可以凌駕於法律之上。

definition: bring order out of chaos/set to rights things which have been thrown into disorder
to call loudly (idiom); to get people's attention/to make one's views known
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
